headline: Apple Cake
description: This easy apple cake is simple to make with pantry staples and fresh fruit for a moist, cinnamon-flavored fall dessert that is great with ice cream.
name: Apple Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease and flour one 9x13-inch baking dish.
Beat oil and eggs in a large bowl until foamy. Add sugar, flour, cinnamon, baking, soda, vanilla, and salt; mix well. Stir in apples. Pour batter into the prepared dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of cake comes out clean, 30 to 40 minutes. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: It was like cookie dough.
Added extra cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, and nutmeg to make it spicier and warmer. Yum!
It's perfect bealive me,I reduced sugar to 1/2 cup and oil to 1/2 cup and add bit of milk
I love this recipe! Added water to thin the batter cause it was initially like cookie dough, the end result was fantastic
I subbed in 1 cup brown sugar for 1cup sugar

Great, moist cake! Had a ton of apples that needed using and this took care of all but one of them. Made some changes according the previous comments. Subbed oil for 1/2C of melted butter, when batter was too dry I added buttermilk until it was more of a thick cake batter texture. Also halved the sugar as the apples were very sweet and that was definitely a good call, tasted great and would have been too sweet I think otherwise. I also added some spices in addition to the cinnamon. I added a tsp of ginger, tsp of cardamom, and 1/2 tsp of nutmeg. It was so easy to throw together and was so good. Next time I might try a streusel topping or something like that for a bit of crunch

It was absolutley delicious! We loved it! I only had a 9x9 cast iron skillet so I had to cook it for 75 min. It tasted like a delicious bread pudding with a crispy carmelized top! Wow! My hubby can't wait for me to make it again!

The batter was very thick, I was concerned about that. I did what others suggested, an extra apple, mixed the apples with sugar snd cinnamon and also did two layers of apples. I drizzled the cooled cake with a powdered sugar glaze. The cake came out so beautiful! My house smells great

Updating my review. Unlike some cakes, this cake is VERY sensitive to the pan you bake it in. If you use a 9 inch round cake pan instead of the pan they suggest be prepared to bake it almost another 45 minutes for the knife to come out clean. Otherwise you will have glop on the plate instead of cake.
Easy to make and delicious.
There is something wrong with this recipe. I could tell by the “batter” it wasn’t going to cook correctly. Epic failure. It was mushy
Nice & easy recipe. I've made it a couple times now with the following adjustments: Halved recipe & put in 8x8 pan, topped it with a combination of crushed walnuts, cinnamon & sugar.
Delicious! I added an apple glaze on top for an extra bit of sweetness. Mix 1 cup of confectioners sugar with 3 tablespoons of apple cider and brush onto the cake once it’s cooled.

It was great! Easy to make and tasty. I pretty much followed the original recipe. I did add a little nutmeg. 1 tablespoon of vanilla and about 1/4 cup of milk. I was pleased with how it turned out. The next time I will cut back the oil to 1/2 cup and use 1/2 cup of milk. I will also try brown sugar. Great with a cup of coffee in the morning or with Ice Cream at night.
We followed directions exactly and it turned in to pizza like dough. We added 1 cup of milk and we will see what happens.

Bundt pan will ensure it cooks in the dense middle. Used 3/4 cup greek yogurt and 1/4 cup oil. Added another tsp of cinnamon, a tsp of nutmeg, a 1/2 tsp of ginger, and 1/4 tsp cardamom. Used cake flour instead of AP. The prepped apples had a little lemon juice and 1/2cup brown sugar already- the juice helped thin the batter a little. Only added 1 cup white sugar. Nice cake! Would make again!
Omg it’s my moms apple cake that I had all my life. I like to add some walnuts and a touch of brown sugar
i have made this hundreds of times always delicious and always am asked for the recipe
I had a can of pineapple and used it instead of apples. I added just a little milk to the batter to where it was more like a cake batter. It turned out amazing.
I didn't make any changes and it turned out wonderful.
Very moist and delicious!! I made a simple icing and drizzled over the top..
This is the best cake ever. I make it once a week for friends, and myself.
Very moist.

I have a huge Granny Smith apple tree.I have made this cake recipe 5 times in the last two weeks.I used Saigon cinnamon and fresh grated nutmeg. Excellent cake and very easy to make.I do them in Bundt pans with Cream cheese frosting with chopped nuts surrounding top
Totally delicious
the dough is very dense. it took 70min to cook. it is tooooo sweet. if I make it again, I will make sugar half.

instead of vanilla i used a splash of red wine, and I had really large apples so 3 would've been fine. I used the juice from all of the apples, though, and they turned out really moist. Also, I always bake in a muffin tin... these baked for 25 minutes
Very delicious!
I made it I cooked the apples down in a butter sauce. It was so yummy. My mom had me make it again.

I made it - lovely smell. Not enough batter for pan so moved it to an 8 x 8. It was raw in the middle but the top and sides were good. Reduced sugar to 1 c, reduced oil to 1/2 c. Seemed fine. It. Sprinkled coarse sugar and almonds on top. 
It was a good cake other than not being baked long enough.
I followed the recipe but I found it rather dry and hard on the edges. After a day the whole cake turned soggy. That was weird. I probably won't make it again.

I switched the full cup of oil for 1/2 C unsalted butter and 1/2 C oil. Also exchanged 2 C white sugar to 1 C dark brown, and 1 C white. I'd already spiced up the cut-up apples with cinnamon, nutmeg, 1/8 C sugar and tossed with cornstarch to help coating the fruit a bit more. I used a 9" round cake pan lined with parchment paper. Total bake time was a bit longer, with an unreliable oven, so it took 1 Hr/08 minutes. I did let it cool overnight before I gave in. I wound up with a rich, not overly sweet cake with a moist crumb and fabulous flavor. I will make this my "go-to" for apple cake from this point forward. Thanks for the great recipe.
it's fluffy!

I made this apple cake today. It was easy and came out great. I followed the recipe exactly. I used Granny Smith apples, which came out great. You don’t want to use sweet apples - tarty apples such as grannies or Macintosh are best in apple cakes. I definitely would make this again!

This was delicious, sweet, and moist! I would give it 5 stars if I hadn't needed to make any changes. My modified version included: No vegetable oil. Instead I used 1/2 cup melted butter (unsalted, or if salted, add less of the salt this recipe calls for. 1 1/2 cups brown sugar. 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce. I kept the skin on the apples. And next time, I will use whole wheat flour with baking powder, instead of white flour. Thanks to others who made the suggestions of no oil, butter instead, brown sugar instead of white sugar, and less sugar, etc. Thanks!
Very good! I also put a streusel topping on it.

My husband loved this cake. I've made it 3 times now. The first time, I followed the recipe exactly. Everyone moaned with the first bite. The second times, I used a bit less oil and sugar and I liked it consistency better, a bit more cake like, a bit less oily. The third time, I added some raisins, about 1 1/2 cups and it was really good. I think some nuts would be a great addition, but I didn't have any on hand. Next time...

I love the idea of using diced apples in a cake. However, I found that the sugar needed to be cut down by 1/2. I used brown (confectioner's sugar) in place of white sugar. It works wonders with the apples and cinnamon. I also made this as a loaf. For the loaf version (which tends to be narrower and taller), adjust bake time to 45-50 min!

I wanted a smaller cake, so halved the recipe and used an 8x8 pan. As others suggested, I reduced oil and sugar amounts too. I doubled the cinnamon and LEFT PEELS ON the apples. I found it needed a couple tablespoons of water to make the batter moist. It was a delicious cake and quick to make.
After reading some reviews, I used 1/4 oil and 1/4 melted better instead of the 1 cup oil in the recipe. The cake came out great, moist and my family loved it.
Easy to make and moist and delicious. Only modification I made was to add a crumble topping, like you do for apple crisp.
The taste is good, but this cake is super greasy and heavy. I won't make it again

I made this cake this morning and it didn't turn out as I expected. I wasn't able to slice it--when cut, it was very crumbly and I had to scoop it out with a spoon. The batter was thick. The result tastes good but just not what I was expecting. Any recommendations?
I made exactly as the recipe. Recipe says pour into pan but my cake was so thick that I almost had to get help to spread it in the pan. It smells wonderful and I'm hopeful.
Love it ! You got to make this!!
Cake came out way too moist. Had a very undone quality to it. Cake just fell apart. Will not be making again.

Very good... I only added chopped walnuts and used half applesauce for half of the oil.
 Thanks Judy.
It was delicious. however, i did add a bit of milk (about 1/4-1/2c of milk tomake the batter a little thinner so i coulf fold the apples in a bit more easily.
I doubled this recipe but used half all-purpose flour and half self-rising flour. I also used a half teaspoon less ground ciinnamon, a half teaspoon more vanilla exttract.

In my opinion this recipe should not be called a cake. Its not a sponge recipes, its more like a bread pudding. I am an experienced cake baker and I should have known better after reading the instructions. 

The taste IS good, although its vary sweet. I tried to make 2 8 inch rounds for my sisters birthday and they were way to crumbly and cooked through, had a strange texture. I wont be using this again.

5 stars with the following modifications (as others suggested): 1/2c oil instead of 1c, 1c white sugar & 1/2c brown (reduces sugar by 1/2c), 2T milk as batter was a bit dry and finally I added 1/2c raisins and an extra Apple because it needed to be used! Yum, I was out of vanilla extract and used equal measurement of maple syrup. The dough will be very chunky like cookie dough but bakes up perfectly. The top has a nice crust and the cake is moist. I did post 3 pics, mixed, going into the oven and the finished cake!

This got rave reviews from everyone who tried it. Made a few changes -- brown sugar instead of white and reduced it to 1 cup because also substituted apple sauce for the oil. Used 1/2 cup oats and 1 1/2 cup flour. Came out amazing!
I used applesauce instead of oil and I split the sugar to 1 cup sugar 1 cup brown sugar. Very easy to put to get together great moist cake. Big hit!

I'm sure this recipe tastes Amazing as is but I wanted to make something a bit healthier for the kids. I substituted all of the oil for low fat vanilla yogurt (1 cup yogurt) and I cut the sugar in half. I also substitued 1/4 cup of flour with wheat germ. It still tastes good and the kids loved it.
Really enjoyed this recipe. Very easy to make and so tasty. Even the kids love it. Keep getting requests to make it again and again :)
It's the best cake ever all family loves it
It tasted great but definitely needed less oil.
Fantastic--this will become a part of my go-to dessert rotation! Easy and delicious. Make it even easier by not peeling apples--saves time, adds nutrition and tastes the same!

loved this as a dessert. however i was worried throughout the baking process. didn't know to what extend foamy mean so just beat the oil and eggs until a lot of bubbles were present. i added all the dry ingredients at once which i think i should not have done because the mixture was dry and i didn't think it was going to blend it. i persisted but the mixture was not a batter. it was very stiff unlike any other cake mixture I'd made before. The suggested baking time was not nearly enough. The cake was a nice colour but was still wobbly in the middle. A further 30 minutes later I decided to remove it from the oven. Despite all my concerns it turned out to be really moist. Next time I will add walnuts or sultanas but I'm not too sure what I could do about the suggested time being doubled what is suggested in the recipe. Any suggestions?
We loved this cake! Changed nothing and it was perfect. Makes the house smell like a fine bakery, too! Thanks for sharing!

Very easy to make! I made it in two 8 inch round pans and it came out perfect in 35 minutes. I agree with some of the reviewers that you could cut out a bit of the sugar because it's really sweet but it's also great as-is! I'm also celiac so I used gluten free flour and my hubby said you couldn't taste a difference :)
This was DELICIOUS!
i made this recipe today...and it did not turn out...
Terrible. The batter did not pour into pan - it was more like a crumble and had to be pressed into the pan. Too sweet and oily. The only tasty part was the apples.
This cake is super easy to make. It's very moist & full of chunks of apple. I only used 1.5 cups of sugar & thought it was plenty. I served it with homemade whipped cream. Yum!

Easy as heck. I am a true non cook, and I decided I did not want to throw out another wilty apple (especially the ones the kids leave in their lunch boxes and forget to tell me about). What a waste, especially since I buy the good organic ones. So I wanted a simple, easy recipe using basic pantry items to turn those slightly shriveled up apples into something fabulous. This was great and the result was yummy. I will definitely do this again. I used olive oil, which was fine. Next time I might use less sugar. Thanks for this recipe! So proud of myself!
Mine wasn't very good.it was very SWEET!

I substituted 1/2 of the oil with applesauce, used 1c. of brown sugar and 1c. of white,I used 3 cups of chopped apples, and baked for 65 minutes, then sprinkled with instant cocoa mix for a light chocolately top.
This is great! Instead of 1c oil I used 1/2 c oil and 1/2 c dark rum. I also shredded the apples.
I made this twice and still really didn't like it. My kids really like stuff like this and wouldn't touch it

This recipe is one of my families favorite. Every where I go with this cake; I 'm asked for the recipe. I started making copies with me before hand so I can just hand them out. It's a moist, delicious comforting desert. It's wonderful. Thank you for sharing the recipe...

Thanks to IBNITWIT who suggested NOT peeling the apples!!! It was a HUGE time saver and the taste is great! This cake is fabulously moist. I'm going to take it to the office because I can't possibly eat that much cake in a day or two. Thanks for this recipe :)

As written, this is pretty good. Heavy for a cake though. Definitely need to reduce the oil, and up the spices. I added cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice. Ginger would be good as well as clove if you like it. I'm making this again this evening, replacing some oil with butter and reducing it overall in the recipe.

followed most of the suggestions, like less oil and sugar, and to add brown sugar and nutmeg,left skin on...i used my favorite honeycrisp apples and am not impressed with this. it is a little flavorless. mine baked in the 9x13 pan and was done at 40 minutes. not sure what else would make it better, maybe the applesauce and butter suggestions. at least my hubby likes it, not sure i am making again.

I never made apple cake before, so I researched many recipes before deciding on this one. First time I made it, I followed the recipe exactly. It was way too sweet for our taste and a little on the oily side. But I think that is a personal preference. Next time, I used one cup of sugar and half a cup of brown sugar. And used only half a cup of oil. It was perfect. I had to bake a little longer because my oven tends to be on the cooler side for the set temperature. I think this cake is more of a muffin texture for me - not a complaint, just an observation, I loved it. I say that because my family likes to eat this for breakfast than dessert. It never stays long enough for me to see how it tastes after a day or two in the fridge. I think next time I will half the recipe and make it in a nine inch round pan. Thank you for an easy and great recipe.
I did not care for this recipe. This was greasy. Too bad :(

Here's the thing. The flavor... AMAZING! I'm giving it 3 stars because like some other reviewers, it would not cook. Even after 50 minutes it was still very mushy on the inside with a hard crust on the top. I think you really have to cut down the oil or something. It was more like a bread pudding.

Followed the recipe to a T . . . but unfortunately the cake came out mushy at the bottom and would not come loose from the pan. I cooled it for half an hour . . . maybe that wasn't enough? I found the end of the recipe to be vague because it didn't specify whether or not the cake was supposed to remain in the pan and for how long it was supposed to cool. I'm afraid to try this again. :-(

Really, I want to give this recipe 4 1/2 stars! Like others suggested, I could have gotten away with cutting some of the sugar and substituting 1/2 the oil with unsweetened applesauce. Definitely do not skimp on the apples; they may look like a lot while you're pouring the batter in the pan, but it's absolutely the right amount when you bring it out of the oven! Partway through I realized I only had about half of what was needed of the flour left in my pantry, so I substituted 3/4 cup of whole wheat flour for the other half. (And it didn't detract from the flavor at all.) Other than that, this is a delicious cake that could star as both dessert and breakfast.

You will not be disappointed, although i did bake for 55 mins and I also reduced the white sugar to 3/4 and also added 3/4 light brown sugar i also cut the oil to 1/2 cup as many previous reviews noted.

We really like this! I cut the sugar by 25% and the oil by 1/2, but replaced the missing oil w/ 1/2 C applesauce. The cake is still very moist and tender, not ridiculously sweet, perfect with a cup of coffee & a great use for all of the apples we picked.

I love this recipe but I do suggest either reducing the oil or replacing it with applesauce. I also like to lightly top the cake with a raspberry sauce at about 5 minutes before the cake is finished. This gives it an extra kick of tart sweetness and keeps the top moist. As it is, I give it 4 stars. With the raspberry topping and oil modifications, my family gives it a 5!

This cake was super good! Did what others suggested - cut down oil and used 3/4 cup. I also used 3/4 cup white sugar and 3/4 brown sugar. Like many others, I noticed batter is super thick so I did add milk, slowly, until batter was more the consistency of cake batter. I also added a streusel topping and it was delicious! Will definitely make this again.
Yum! I added some cloves, and did half white sugar and half brown sugar. When the cake came out of the oven I poked holes in it and poured caramel ice cream topping all over it. Delicious!

Just made this cake and it turned out delicious! Best apple cake i have ever tried/made. I used 1 cup of organic sugar instead of white sugar and 1 cup of brown sugar. I also used olive oil instead of vegetable oil, and it turned out great :) at the end I topped it off with just a little bit of condensed milk and some side fresh strawberries. yummy :)
My cake turned out to be perfect. As suggested by other reviewers, I reduced my oil and sugar to 1cup. I added few chopped pieces of figs for flavor. Took 40-45 mins to bake. Loved it!!

I made this when my in-laws were here for a long weekend and they asked me to make a second since we gobbled up the first! After reading other reviews I used 2/3 cup oil and 1cup white sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar. Yummy!

Very easy, very good. edit: this time I used 1 cup brown sugar and one cup white sugar. 3/4 cup oil and didn't peel apples . This time I used my 9 x 13 glass dish, took way longer to cook, approx. 55 mins. Very good
No idea what I did wrong.

Delicious!, i made a few changes, because I wanted it to be healthier...1 cup white flour and 1 cup of kamut flour...3/4 cup sugar (2 cups is excessive!) I then put about half the batter in a loaf pan, layered a mound of extra apples on top and then topped it off with the remaining batter. I mixed all the wet ingredients in a cuisinart, and the dry in a bowl before adding to the wet. Result was a beautiful apple loaf!!

I added 1/4 tsp. allspice, reduced the sugar by 1/4 cup, and reduced the oil by 1/4 cup as well. It was thick and chunky, but I didn't add any milk or anything because I trusted that the apples would cook down and make a dense, moist cake. I think you could halve the oil and it would still be awesome. I'll try that next time, because this was delicious - even better the next day! I might add nuts, too, and as someone mentioned, a dusting of powdered sugar would look nice.
This is the best! My batter was also very thick, so I added about 2 tablespoons of milk. Instead of 1 cup white sugar, I added 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup white sugar. It turned out perfect!

wow total flop for me. The picture at the top is very decieving. Mine turned out like a crumble and not a cake. I will use it as a topping to ice cream and that about it. I would definely add alot of milk if i was to ever try this recipe again.

Reduced oil to 3/4 cups. 
Used 1 1/2 cups of sugar. 1 white, 1/2 brown sugar.
Added 1 cup of pecans.
Baked for 50 minutes.
Delicious.

I've made this recipe for years but have always made it as squares. I lightly sprinkle the top with cinnamon nad sugar which gives it a crispy top. Make a double batch, your kids will inhale the first one.

AMAZING! This is the best apple cake ever! I did make a couple changes. I used only 3/4c of oil..but subbed 1/2c for applesauce. I also used the suggestion of 2/3c white sugar, 2/3 c brown sugar. I also had to bake it for nearly 50mins before the bottom of the cake cooked. But even if it hadn't it wouldve still tasted amazing!
Had to add a bit of milk as it was too dry. Sprinkled with icing sugar, very good!

Fantastic cake! I took the advice of some others and reduced the oil to 3/4 cup. I also used 3/4 cup brown sugar and 3/4 cup white sugar and added milk until it turned into cake batter. And the streusel on top is great! Definitely will make again.
Very easy to make and very delicious! I used 4 medium sized apples without peeling them, it turned out great! Thanks for the recipe!
